trial_identification.studytitle: Eye surgery under regional anaesthesia - what's going on beneath the drapes?
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Novel oxygen delivery system to elective opthalmic surgery patients comparing inspired oxygen & carbon dioxide and end-tidal carbon dioxide levels under the surgical drapes & their effect on patient's vital signs.

conditions.healthcondition: Level of inspired oxygen under drapes used for elective opthalmic surgical procedures.
Level of inspired carbon dioxide under drapes used for elective opthalmic surgical procedures.
Level of end-tidal carbon dioxide under drapes used for elective opthalmic surgical procedures.

interventions.interventions:
Observational pilot study.
Patients undergoing elective ophthalmic operations under regional anaesthesia were enrolled in this study after informed consent.
Standard, waterproof ophthalmic drapes were used to cover the patients during the procedure and oxygen was administered via a modified plastic canister at a flow rate of 6L/min.
In this study we characterise this elderly population and show patients are exposed to an increased FiO2, FiCO2 and EtCO2 as the operation progressed without adverse events.
The overall duration of the study was 3 months.
interventions.comparator: This current observational pilot study referred to looks at the oxygen delivery system used at our institution.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Primary outcome: Inspired oxygen (FiO2) level under surgical drapes. Assessed with gas monitoring line under surgical drape.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Time interval: at 5-10 min intervals until cessation of surgical procedure.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Primary outcome: Inspired & End-tidal carbon dioxide level under surgical drapes. Assessed with gas monitoring line under surgical drape.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Time interval: at 5-10 min intervals until cessation of surgical procedure.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Primary outcome: Inspired and end-tidal carbon dioxide level under surgical drapes. Assessed with gas monitoring line under surgical drape.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Time interval: at 5-10 min intervals until cessation of surgical procedure.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary outcome: Patient's oxygen saturation (SaO2) and mean arterial blood pressure (MAP) Assessed with pulse oximeter.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Time interval: at 5-10 min intervals until cessation of surgical procedure

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary outcome: Patient's heart & respiratory rate (HR & RR). Assessed with ECG monitor and clinical assessment.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Time interval: at 5-10 min intervals until cessation of surgical procedure

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients were included in the study if they were undergoing ophthalmic surgery under regional or topical anaesthesia, over 18 and able to give informed consent.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: None elective opthalmic surgery No informed consent General anaesthesia Contra-indication to regional opthalmic anaesthesia Inability to lie flat & still for operation duration Under 18 years

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Thirty four patients undergoing elective ophthalmic operations under regional anaesthesia were enrolled in this study after informed consent. Standard, waterproof ophthalmic drapes were used to cover the patients during the procedure and oxygen was administered via a modified plastic canister at a flow rate of 6L/min. In this study we characterise this elderly population and show patients are exposed to an increased inspired oxygen (FiO2), inspired carbon dioxide (FiCO2) and end-tidal carbon dioxide (EtCO2) level. The operation progressed without adverse events.
